cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to cross central Florida today, emerge off the east-central Florida coast early Tuesday, then accelerate northeast just offshore of Georgia–South Carolina and toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Florida west coast near/just north of Tampa

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anclote River to Englewood, FL (west-central Florida Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida today, then the Atlantic coasts of Florida, Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina through Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30-40 mph) possible Tuesday afternoon into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as rain bands brush the coast Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along South Carolina beaches
